pageContext.claim: “We can build the wall in one year and we can build it for much less money than what they're talking about.”
pageContext.analysis: Under no scenario can the wall on the Mexican border be built in just one year. A retired estimator and economist for one of the nation’s largest construction firms told The Fact Checker that building the wall would require at least 40,000 workers a year for at least four years, but he doubted it could be built so quickly. A report by Bernstein Research, which estimated a cost of between $15 billion and $25 billion, estimated up to two years for planning and land acquisition and two years for construction, though the report said it could take up to ten years.
